newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch DSM in joint venture with Germany's BASF.
newsitem.headline: Dutch DSM in joint venture with Germany's BASF.

text.p: Dutch chemicals group DSM NV said on Monday it had reached a definitive agreement on the establishment of DSM-BASF Structural Resins, a 60/40 joint venture in the field of unsaturated polyester resins.
"The new company will be Europe's largest supplier of unsaturated polyester resins with annual sales of around 500 million guilders ($292.4 million)," it said in a statement.
DSM-BASF Structural Resins will start its operations on January 1, 1997.
The company's head office will be in the nothern Dutch city of Zwolle.

"DSM and BASF are merging their activities in unsaturated polyester resins to create the economies of scale which, in a fragmented market, are required to meet customers' growing demand for product improvement and new applications," it said.
The partnership is also a response to increasing international competetion, especially from the USA. ($1=1.710 Guilder)
